channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: FedCL: Federated Multi-Phase Curriculum Learning to Synchronously Correlate User Heterogeneity
item.description: A key challenge in FL is to handle the heterogeneity of local data distribution, resulting in a drifted global model, which is hard to converge.

item.title: Redeeming Intrinsic Rewards via Constrained Optimization
item.description: Such methods can lead to excellent results on hard exploration tasks but can suffer from intrinsic reward bias and underperform when compared to an agent trained using only task rewards.

item.title: Exploiting Device and Audio Data to Tag Music with User-Aware Listening Contexts
item.description: Namely, we propose a system which can generate a situational playlist for a user at a certain time 1) by leveraging user-aware music autotaggers, and 2) by automatically inferring the user's situation from stream data (e. g. device, network) and user's general profile information (e. g. age).

item.title: What Images are More Memorable to Machines?
item.description: This paper studies the problem of measuring and predicting how memorable an image is to pattern recognition machines, as a path to explore machine intelligence.

item.title: Retrieval-Augmented Generative Question Answering for Event Argument Extraction
item.description: We propose a retrieval-augmented generative QA model (R-GQA) for event argument extraction.

item.title: Efficient Adversarial Training with Robust Early-Bird Tickets
item.description: Adversarial training is one of the most powerful methods to improve the robustness of pre-trained language models (PLMs).

item.title: Evade the Trap of Mediocrity: Promoting Diversity and Novelty in Text Generation via Concentrating Attention
item.description: In this work, we dig into the intrinsic mechanism of this problem and found that sparser attention values in Transformer could improve diversity.

item.title: Treatment-RSPN: Recurrent Sum-Product Networks for Sequential Treatment Regimes
item.description: Models developed using our framework benefit from the full range of RSPN capabilities, including the abilities to model the full distribution of the data, to seamlessly handle latent variables, missing values and categorical data, and to efficiently perform marginal and conditional inference.

item.title: Cross-Modality Knowledge Distillation Network for Monocular 3D Object Detection
item.description: Leveraging LiDAR-based detectors or real LiDAR point data to guide monocular 3D detection has brought significant improvement, e. g., Pseudo-LiDAR methods.

item.title: Advancing the State-of-the-Art for ECG Analysis through Structured State Space Models
item.description: The field of deep-learning-based ECG analysis has been largely dominated by convolutional architectures.

item.title: Universal EHR Federated Learning Framework
item.description: Federated learning (FL) is the most practical multi-source learning method for electronic healthcare records (EHR).

item.title: MT4SSL: Boosting Self-Supervised Speech Representation Learning by Integrating Multiple Targets
item.description: In this paper, we provide a new perspective on self-supervised speech models from how the self-training targets are obtained.

item.title: Why Did the Chicken Cross the Road? Rephrasing and Analyzing Ambiguous Questions in VQA
item.description: Resolving ambiguities in questions is key to successfully answering them.

item.title: Self-distillation with Online Diffusion on Batch Manifolds Improves Deep Metric Learning
item.description: However, this type of method normally ignores the crucial knowledge hidden in the data (e. g., intra-class information variation), which is harmful to the generalization of the trained model.

item.title: PKCAM: Previous Knowledge Channel Attention Module
item.description: Recently, attention mechanisms have been explored with ConvNets, both across the spatial and channel dimensions.

item.title: Self-Supervised Image Restoration with Blurry and Noisy Pairs
item.description: By learning in a collaborative manner, the deblurring and denoising tasks in our method can benefit each other.

item.title: Finding Skill Neurons in Pre-trained Transformer-based Language Models
item.description: Furthermore, we demonstrate the skill neurons are most likely generated in pre-training rather than fine-tuning by showing that the skill neurons found with prompt tuning are also crucial for other fine-tuning methods freezing neuron weights, such as the adapter-based tuning and BitFit.

item.title: Discovering a Variety of Objects in Spatio-Temporal Human-Object Interactions
item.description: In daily HOIs, humans often interact with a variety of objects, e. g., holding and touching dozens of household items in cleaning.

item.title: Are Hard Examples also Harder to Explain? A Study with Human and Model-Generated Explanations
item.description: We observe that (1) GPT-3 explanations are as grammatical as human explanations regardless of the hardness of the test samples, (2) for easy examples, GPT-3 generates highly supportive explanations but human explanations are more generalizable, and (3) for hard examples, human explanations are significantly better than GPT-3 explanations both in terms of label-supportiveness and generalizability judgements.

item.title: Detecting Line Segments in Motion-blurred Images with Events
item.description: To robustly detect line segments over motion blurs, we propose to leverage the complementary information of images and events.

item.title: Latent-NeRF for Shape-Guided Generation of 3D Shapes and Textures
item.description: This unique combination of text and shape guidance allows for increased control over the generation process.

item.title: IFQA: Interpretable Face Quality Assessment
item.description: Existing face restoration models have relied on general assessment metrics that do not consider the characteristics of facial regions.

item.title: MedleyVox: An Evaluation Dataset for Multiple Singing Voices Separation
item.description: In this paper, we present an evaluation dataset and provide baseline studies for multiple singing voices separation.

item.title: Language models are good pathologists: using attention-based sequence reduction and text-pretrained transformers for efficient WSI classification
item.description: In digital pathology, Whole Slide Image (WSI) analysis is usually formulated as a Multiple Instance Learning (MIL) problem.

item.title: CurvPnP: Plug-and-play Blind Image Restoration with Deep Curvature Denoiser
item.description: Due to the development of deep learning-based denoisers, the plug-and-play strategy has achieved great success in image restoration problems.

item.title: LGN-Net: Local-Global Normality Network for Video Anomaly Detection
item.description: Some of them focus on learning local spatiotemporal representations from consecutive frames in video clips to enhance the representation for normal events.

item.title: Fast Text-Conditional Discrete Denoising on Vector-Quantized Latent Spaces
item.description: Conditional text-to-image generation has seen countless recent improvements in terms of quality, diversity and fidelity.

item.title: CabViT: Cross Attention among Blocks for Vision Transformer
item.description: The proposed CabViT enhances the interactions of tokens across blocks with potentially different semantics, and encourages more information flows to the lower levels, which together improves model performance and model convergence with limited extra cost.

item.title: Deep Autoregressive Regression
item.description: In this work, we demonstrate that a major limitation of regression using a mean-squared error loss is its sensitivity to the scale of its targets.

item.title: Calibrated Interpretation: Confidence Estimation in Semantic Parsing
item.description: We examine the calibration characteristics of six models across three model families on two common English semantic parsing datasets, finding that many models are reasonably well-calibrated and that there is a trade-off between calibration and performance.

item.title: Dealing with missing data using attention and latent space regularization
item.description: Most practical data science problems encounter missing data.

item.title: EVA: Exploring the Limits of Masked Visual Representation Learning at Scale
item.description: We launch EVA, a vision-centric foundation model to explore the limits of visual representation at scale using only publicly accessible data.

item.title: SportsTrack: An Innovative Method for Tracking Athletes in Sports Scenes
item.description: The SportsMOT competition aims to solve multiple object tracking of athletes in different sports scenes such as basketball or soccer.

item.title: Temporal patterns in insulin needs for Type 1 diabetes
item.description: Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) is a chronic condition where the body produces little or no insulin, a hormone required for the cells to use blood glucose (BG) for energy and to regulate BG levels in the body.

item.title: On Analyzing the Role of Image for Visual-enhanced Relation Extraction
item.description: Multimodal relation extraction is an essential task for knowledge graph construction.

item.title: MAVEN-ERE: A Unified Large-scale Dataset for Event Coreference, Temporal, Causal, and Subevent Relation Extraction
item.description: It contains 103, 193 event coreference chains, 1, 216, 217 temporal relations, 57, 992 causal relations, and 15, 841 subevent relations, which is larger than existing datasets of all the ERE tasks by at least an order of magnitude.

item.title: AdaptKeyBERT: An Attention-Based approach towards Few-Shot \& Zero-Shot Domain Adaptation of KeyBERT
item.description: Downstream training for keyword extractors is a lengthy process and requires a significant amount of data.

item.title: Unsupervised Face Recognition using Unlabeled Synthetic Data
item.description: In this paper, we propose an unsupervised face recognition model based on unlabeled synthetic data (USynthFace).

item.title: CST5: Data Augmentation for Code-Switched Semantic Parsing
item.description: To aid further research in this area, we are also releasing (a) Hinglish-TOP, the largest human annotated code-switched semantic parsing dataset to date, containing 10k human annotated Hindi-English (Hinglish) code-switched utterances, and (b) Over 170K CST5 generated code-switched utterances from the TOPv2 dataset.

item.title: MetaKRec: Collaborative Meta-Knowledge Enhanced Recommender System
item.description: To fill this gap, in this paper, we explore the rich, heterogeneous relationship among items and propose a new KG-enhanced recommendation model called Collaborative Meta-Knowledge Enhanced Recommender System (MetaKRec).

item.title: Model Evaluation in Medical Datasets Over Time
item.description: Machine learning models deployed in healthcare systems face data drawn from continually evolving environments.

item.title: Follow the Clairvoyant: an Imitation Learning Approach to Optimal Control
item.description: We consider control of dynamical systems through the lens of competitive analysis.

item.title: Enhancing Few-shot Image Classification with Cosine Transformer
item.description: Our proposed method FS-CT along with the Cosine attention is simple to implement and can be applied for a wide range of applications.

item.title: Instance-based Learning for Knowledge Base Completion
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new method for knowledge base completion (KBC): instance-based learning (IBL).

item.title: Language Model Classifier Aligns Better with Physician Word Sensitivity than XGBoost on Readmission Prediction
item.description: We assess the sensitivity score on a set of representative words in the test set using two classifiers trained for hospital readmission classification with similar performance statistics.

item.title: TorchOpt: An Efficient Library for Differentiable Optimization
item.description: TorchOpt further provides a high-performance distributed execution runtime.

item.title: Out-of-Dynamics Imitation Learning from Multimodal Demonstrations
item.description: Existing imitation learning works mainly assume that the demonstrator who collects demonstrations shares the same dynamics as the imitator.

item.title: FPT: Improving Prompt Tuning Efficiency via Progressive Training
item.description: Inspired by these observations, we propose Fast Prompt Tuning (FPT), which starts by conducting PT using a small-scale partial PLM, and then progressively expands its depth and width until the full-model size.

item.title: Xu at SemEval-2022 Task 4: Pre-BERT Neural Network Methods vs Post-BERT RoBERTa Approach for Patronizing and Condescending Language Detection
item.description: This paper describes my participation in the SemEval-2022 Task 4: Patronizing and Condescending Language Detection.

item.title: A Tale of Two Graphs: Freezing and Denoising Graph Structures for Multimodal Recommendation
item.description: Based on this finding, we propose a simple yet effective model, dubbed as FREEDOM, that FREEzes the item-item graph and DenOises the user-item interaction graph simultaneously for Multimodal recommendation.
